hymn.title: The Church is Christ's own Body

lyrics.stanza: The Church is Christ's own Body, The Father's dwelling-place, The gathering of the called ones, God blended with man's race; Elect before creation, Redeemed by Calv'ry's death, Her character and standing Of heaven, not of earth.

New man of new creation, Born through her risen Lord, Baptized in God the Spirit, Made holy by His Word; Christ is her life and content, Himself her glorious Head; She has ascended with Him O'er all her foes to tread.

From every tribe and nation Do all the members come, Regardless of their classes United to be one. No high there is, nor lowly, No Jew, nor Gentile clan, No free, nor slave, nor master, But Christ, the "one new man."

Her local gatherings model The New Jerusalem; Its aspects and its details Must show in all of them. Christ is the Lamp that shineth, With God within, the Light; They are the lampstands bearing His glorious Image bright.
